title: quarto features
text: 1 Take penguins, , 2 add new columns bill ratio bill area.
code: library(tidyverse) library(palmerpenguins) 1penguins |> 2  mutate(     bill_ratio = bill_depth_mm / bill_length_mm,     bill_area  = bill_depth_mm * bill_length_mm   )

title: quarto features
code: matplotlib.py import matplotlib.pyplot as plt plt.plot([1,23,2,4]) plt.show()

title: quarto features
text: Note Note five types callouts, including: note, warning, important, tip, caution. Tip Title example callout title. Expand Learn Collapse example ‘folded’ caution callout can expanded user. can use collapse="true" collapse default collapse="false" make collapsible callout expanded default. Pay Attention Using callouts effective way highlight content reader give special consideration attention. Pay Attention Using callouts effective way highlight content reader give special consideration attention. Tip 1: Cross-Referencing Tip Add ID starting #tip- reference tip. See Tip 1…

title: quarto features
code: flowchart LR   A[Hard edge] --> B(Round edge)   B --> C{Decision}   C --> D[Result one]   C --> E[Result two]

title: Output Rendering
text: Testing margins copy buttons small screens. Wrapped <section> (e.g. section > div > pre) blockquote enough text test width code block verify whether aligns paragraph width. Continue… list item includes enough text test width code block check whether matches paragraph width. Another bullet. Nested list. Second level item enough text test width code block confirm alignment paragraph. Nested list continues.
code: txt <- "Not wrapped; check the copy button behavior." txt <- "Wrapped in section" txt <- "Wrapped in blockquote; margins are preserved." txt <- "Wrapped in li; margins are preserved." txt <- "Wrapped in li; margins are preserved." txt <- "Wrapped in details"

title: quarto vignettes
text: pkgdown turns articles directory quarto project temporarily adding _quarto.yml articles. can also add want control options quarto articles. , mix .qmd .Rmd files, ’ll need include following yaml RMarkdown can continue handle .Rmd files: setup-r-dependencies action automatically install Quarto GitHub Actions .qmd file present repository (see install-quarto parameter details).

title: quarto vignettes
text: setup-r-dependencies action automatically install Quarto GitHub Actions .qmd file present repository (see install-quarto parameter details).

title: quarto vignettes
text: Callouts currently supported (https://github.com/quarto-dev/quarto-cli/issues/9963). pkgdown assumes ’re using quarto vignette style, generally html format minimal: true. Specifically, HTML vignettes currently supported. can’t customise mermaid styles quarto mermaid themes. want change colours, ’ll need provide custom CSS shown quarto docs. pkgdown pass lang setting quarto, set available languages perfectly matched. Learn https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/language.html, including supply translations.

title: quarto vignettes
text: following sections demonstrate bunch useful quarto features can make sure work. Small caps footnote reference1  () sketch pitbull puppy (b) sketch sharpei puppy Figure 1: Cute puppies ∂C∂t+12σ2S2∂2C∂C2+rS∂C∂S=rC(1) \frac{\partial \mathrm C}{ \partial \mathrm t } + \frac{1}{2}\sigma^{2} \mathrm S^{2} \frac{\partial^{2} \mathrm C}{\partial \mathrm C^2}   + \mathrm r \mathrm S \frac{\partial \mathrm C}{\partial \mathrm S}\ =   \mathrm r \mathrm C  \qquad(1) See Figure 1 two cute puppies. Black-Scholes (Equation 1) mathematical model seeks explain behavior financial derivatives, commonly options.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Diego Hernangómez. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hernangómez D (2026). gitdevr: 'pkgdown' Template. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://dieghernan.github.io/gitdevr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gitdevr: My 'pkgdown' Template},   author = {Diego Hernangómez},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://dieghernan.github.io/gitdevr/}, }

title: My pkgdown Template
text: gitdevr provides custom pkgdown template based GitDev skin provided Jekyll theme chulapa. See preview template https://dieghernan.github.io/gitdevr/

title: My pkgdown Template
text: can install developing version gitdevr : Alternatively, can install gitdevr using r-universe:
code: pak::pak("dieghernan/gitdevr") # Install gitdevr in R: install.packages(   "gitdevr",   repos = c(     "https://dieghernan.r-universe.dev",     "https://cloud.r-project.org"   ) )

title: My pkgdown Template
text: successful installation, already pkgdown setup ready, need specify template parameter follow. , , can build site using pkgdown::build_site(). Keep mind use default_assets: false change default template. gitdevr relies pkgdown assets templates. recommended add following line DESCRIPTION: , using r-lib actions deploying site, github action install package automatically.
code: .pkgdown.yaml template:   bootstrap: 5   package: gitdevr DESCRIPTION Config/Needs/website: dieghernan/gitdevr

title: gitdevr: My 'pkgdown' Template — gitdevr-package
text: 'pkgdown' template packages. Template based skin 'GitDev' Jekyll template 'chulapa' https://dieghernan.github.io/chulapa/skins/gitdev.

title: gitdevr: My 'pkgdown' Template — gitdevr-package
text: Maintainer: Diego Hernangómez diego.hernangomezherrero@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]
